{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the artery that can be palpated at the anterior border of the masseter muscle. The masseter muscle is a facial muscle that plays a major role in the chewing of solid foods. The muscle is located at the side of the face and is easily visible and palpable when the teeth are clenched. According to Document [17], the pulse of the facial artery is palpable at the anteroinferior angle of the masseter muscle against the bony surface of the mandible. Therefore, the facial artery is the artery that can be palpated at the anterior border of the masseter.", "answer_choice": "B. Facial artery"}
